Name: Ernst von Weizsäcker
Function: Permanent Secretary of State in the Auswärtiges Amt (Foreign Ministry) under Ribbentrop until 1943, then ambassador to the Holy See; SS-Brigadeführer.
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949, released in October 1950.

Name: Gustav Adolf Steengracht von Moyland
Function: Successor of von Weizsäcker as Secretary of State in the Foreign Ministry (until 1945)
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949, released 1950

Name: Wilhelm Keppler
Function: Secretary of State; Hitler's advisor for economy
Sentence: 10 years' imprisonment; released 1951

Name: Ernst Wilhelm Bohle
Function: NS-Gauleiter, Secretary of State in the Foreign Ministry; head of the Auslandorganisation (foreign organization) of the NSDAP.
Sentence: 5 years' imprisonment

Name: Ernst Woermann (de)
Function: Secretary in the Foreign Ministry; head of the political division.
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949; released 1951

Name: Karl Ritter
Function: Liaison between Foreign Office and the High Command of the German armed forces.
Sentence: 4 years' imprisonment incl. time already served; released after the judgment.

Name: Otto von Erdmannsdorff
Function: Secretary in the Foreign Ministry; deputy to Wörmann.
Sentence: acquitted

Name: Edmund Veesenmayer
Function: Plenipotentiary in Hungary
Sentence: 20 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in 1951 and released the same year.

Name: Hans Heinrich Lammers
Function: Head of the Reich Chancellery
Sentence: 20 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in January 1951 and released December 16, 1951.

Name: Wilhelm Stuckart
Function: Secretary of State in the Interior Ministry
Sentence: Time already served (3 years and 10 months)

Name: Richard Walther Darré
Function: Minister for Food and Agriculture
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; released 1950

Name: Otto Meissner
Function: Head of the Presidential Chancellery
Sentence: acquitted

Name: Otto Dietrich
Function: Reichspressechef of the NSDAP and Secretary of State in the Propagandaministerium
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment incl. time already served; released in 1950.

Name: Gottlob Berger
Function: Head of the SS-Hauptamt, SS-Obergruppenführer
Sentence: 25 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in 1951; released the same year.

Name: Walter Schellenberg
Function: Second-in-command of the Gestapo, head of the SD and the Abwehr, and successor of Wilhelm Canaris as the head of the Combined Secret Services; SS-Brigadeführer.
Sentence: 6 years' imprisonment incl. time already served

Name: Lutz Graf Schwerin von Krosigk
Function: Minister of Finance
Sentence: 10 years' imprisonment; released in 1951

Name: Emil Puhl
Function: Vice-president of the Reichsbank
Sentence: 5 years' imprisonment incl. time already served

Name: Karl Rasche
Function: Director of the Dresdner Bank
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment incl. time already served

Name: Paul Körner (de)
Function: Secretary of State, deputy of Göring.
Sentence: 15 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in 1951; released the same year.

Name: Paul Pleiger
Function: Head of the Reichswerke Hermann Göring (confiscated steel plants employing slave laborers)
Sentence: 15 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in 1951; released the same year.

Name: Hans Kehrl (de)
Function: Secretary in the Ministry of Armament; head of the planning office
Sentence: 15 years' imprisonment; released in 1951
